subtasks: Identifying and correcting common misconceptions
Understanding the botany and origin of peanuts
Learning about the climate requirements for peanut cultivation
Selecting appropriate peanut varieties for different regions
Proper soil preparation and drainage considerations
Seed preparation and planting techniques (hulled vs unhulled)
Starting peanut plants indoors for northern gardeners
Outdoor planting methods and timing
Plant spacing and careful planting to avoid damaging the crown
Hilling the soil around peanut plants
Managing soil moisture and appropriate watering schedules
Monitoring for signs of maturity and harvesting techniques
Storage and preservation of harvested peanuts

tasks.task: So in total, maybe six MAINTASKs (planting, selecting varieties, fertilization, growing, monitoring maturity, and harvesting/storage). But given the word limit might need to combine some similar tasks.

subtasks: Selecting seeds (hulled or unhulled)
Starting indoor seedlings for northern gardeners (1 month before last frost)
Transplanting seedlings outdoors (soil 60-70°F)
Proper planting depth (2 inches) and spacing (5 inches apart in rows 2-3 feet)
Creating furrows for planting and covering seeds
Applying a light mulch to prevent soil crusting
Watering weekly (1 inch) and avoiding overwatering
Testing soil fertility (leguminous plants fix nitrogen)
Hilling soil around plants when they reach a foot in height
Monitoring for signs of maturity (yellow leaves, gold-marked shells)
Pulling plants when ripe (soil moist, avoiding brittle pegs)
Drying plants in an airy location
Removing pods carefully once cured
